For internal usage see _transfer Requires - Caller cannot be zero - Caller must have a balance = or bigger than amount"},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"transferFrom is uesd to transfer Tokens from a Accounts allowance Spender address should be the token holder Requires   - The caller must have a allowance = or bigger than the amount spending"},"transferOwnership(address)":{"notice":"transferOwnership will assign the {newOwner} as owner"}},"notice":"DevToken is a development token that we use to learn how to code solidity and what BEP-20 interface requires","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"project:/contracts/DevToken.sol":"DevToken"},"evmVersion":"london","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"project:/contracts/DevToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4658c2b787c35f56d111dddc50ecbe17bd9fcc4fe510069b29e2000252cb9bf6","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c386ddc5e63b4b3da27ad55f3d6a7e097bfcd2fe1705a09263ee2c8f6c21a70d","dweb:/ipfs/Qmf5NYj13LQXJAWVCoi6BiLiS97A3at6jE49A15R2YfRxA"]},"project:/contracts/Ownable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc17b0f8c4e97385bc68dd9a48b0ec86d31de3e249dd8872b90905bac9caf9e31","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://9f50ee6c1d700b14251516eed7c9c1fd460299b1babfd3b7b77cfabd3beb863b","dweb:/ipfs/QmY5RHiZg4gG1XYHoTFszrq74bKSvErmhBvoHskPa1JV1o"]},"project:/contracts/Stakable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x254f37593d4a78c494f949025185672a404091d0ea953ca4e25cabc17120962f","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://eb627e86e23ace6afaac7eb516bd5ecd0cd0cfe42004a0bad528be7a9cbc420e","dweb:/ipfs/Qma1vejqqfmL9fuCFba8zc2Z7fQXYjyy1s1M8txxofzRPa"]}},"version":1}

deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@notice DevToken is a development token that we use to learn how to code solidity
 and what BEP-20 interface requires
@notice Our Tokens required variables that are needed to operate everything

@notice _balances is a mapping that contains a address as KEY
 and the balance of the address as the value

@notice Events are created below.
 Transfer event is a event that notify the blockchain that a transfer of assets has taken place

@notice constructor will be triggered when we create the Smart contract
 _name = name of the token
 _short_symbol = Short Symbol name for the token
 token_decimals = The decimal precision of the Token, defaults 18
 _totalSupply is how much Tokens there are totally
@notice decimals will return the number of decimal precision the Token is deployed with
@notice symbol will return the Token's symbol
@notice name will return the Token's symbol
@notice totalSupply will return the tokens total supply of tokens
@notice balanceOf will return the account balance for the given account

documentation.text:
@notice _burn will destroy tokens from an address inputted and then decrease total supply
 An Transfer event will emit with receiever set to zero address
 Requires
 - Account cannot be zero
 - Account balance has to be bigger or equal to amount

@notice transfer is used to transfer funds from the sender to the recipient
 This function is only callable from outside the contract. For internal usage see
 _transfer
 Requires
 - Caller cannot be zero
 - Caller must have a balance = or bigger than amount

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DevToken: cant transfer more than your account holds"

arguments.value: DevToken: cant transfer more than your account holds

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "DevToken: cant transfer more than your account holds"

documentation.text:
@notice _transfer is used for internal transfers
 Events
 - Transfer
 Requires
  - Sender cannot be zero
  - recipient cannot be zero
  - sender balance most be = or bigger than amount

@notice _allowances is used to manage and control allownace
 An allowance is the right to use another accounts balance, or part of it

@notice Approval is emitted when a new Spender is approved to spend Tokens on
 the Owners account

@notice getOwner just calls Ownables owner function.
 returns owner of the token
@notice allowance is used view how much allowance an spender has
@notice approve will use the senders address and allow the spender to use X amount of tokens on his behalf

documentation.text:
@notice transferFrom is uesd to transfer Tokens from a Accounts allowance
 Spender address should be the token holder
 Requires
   - The caller must have a allowance = or bigger than the amount spending

@notice increaseAllowance
 Adds allowance to a account from the function caller address

@notice decreaseAllowance
 Decrease the allowance on the account inputted from the caller address

Approval(address,address,uint256).notice: Approval is emitted when a new Spender is approved to spend Tokens on the Owners account

OwnershipTransferred(address,address).notice: Event OwnershipTransferred is used to log that a ownership change of the token has occured

Staked(address,uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Staked event is triggered whenever a user stakes tokens, address is indexed to make it filterable

Transfer(address,address,uint256).notice: Events are created below. Transfer event is a event that notify the blockchain that a transfer of assets has taken place

allowance(address,address).notice: allowance is used view how much allowance an spender has

approve(address,uint256).notice: approve will use the senders address and allow the spender to use X amount of tokens on his behalf

balanceOf(address).notice: balanceOf will return the account balance for the given account

burn(address,uint256).notice: burn is used to destroy tokens on an address See {_burn} Requires   - msg.sender must be the token owner

constructor.notice: constructor will be triggered when we create the Smart contract _name = name of the token _short_symbol = Short Symbol name for the token token_decimals = The decimal precision of the Token, defaults 18 _totalSupply is how much Tokens there are totally

decimals().notice: decimals will return the number of decimal precision the Token is deployed with

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: decreaseAllowance Decrease the allowance on the account inputted from the caller address

getOwner().notice: getOwner just calls Ownables owner function. returns owner of the token

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: increaseAllowance Adds allowance to a account from the function caller address

mint(address,uint256).notice: mint is used to create tokens and assign them to msg.sender See {_mint} Requires   - msg.sender must be the token owner

name().notice: name will return the Token's symbol

owner().notice: owner() returns the currently assigned owner of the Token

renounceOwnership().notice: renounceOwnership will set the owner to zero address This will make the contract owner less, It will make ALL functions with onlyOwner no longer callable. There is no way of restoring the owner

stake(uint256).notice: Add functionality like burn to the _stake afunction

symbol().notice: symbol will return the Token's symbol

totalSupply().notice: totalSupply will return the tokens total supply of tokens

transfer(address,uint256).notice: transfer is used to transfer funds from the sender to the recipient This function is only callable from outside the contract. For internal usage see _transfer Requires - Caller cannot be zero - Caller must have a balance = or bigger than amount

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: transferFrom is uesd to transfer Tokens from a Accounts allowance Spender address should be the token holder Requires   - The caller must have a allowance = or bigger than the amount spending

transferOwnership(address).notice: transferOwnership will assign the {newOwner} as owner
